info.title: openconfig-acl
info.description:
OpenConfig configuration data model

**Module:** `openconfig-acl`
**Paths:** 3

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View openconfig-acl structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/openconfig-acl.html)

get.description:
Top level enclosing container for ACL model config
        and operational state data

put.description:
Create or replace Top level enclosing container for ACL model config
        and operational state data

patch.description:
Partially modify Top level enclosing container for ACL model config
        and operational state data

delete.description:
Delete Top level enclosing container for ACL model config
        and operational state data

put.description: Create or replace Global config data for ACLs

patch.description: Partially modify Global config data for ACLs

delete.description: Delete Global config data for ACLs

get.description: Global operational state data for ACLs

put.description: Create or replace Global operational state data for ACLs

patch.description: Partially modify Global operational state data for ACLs

delete.description: Delete Global operational state data for ACLs

counter-capability.description:
System reported indication of how ACL counters are reported
        by the target

name.description: Reference to the name list key

description.description:
A user-defined description, or comment, for this Access List
        Entry.

sequence-id.description: Reference to per-interface acl entry key

matched-packets.description:
Count of the number of packets matching the current ACL
        entry.

        An implementation should provide this counter on a
        per-interface per-ACL-entry if possible.

        If an implementation only supports ACL counters per entry
        (i.e., not broken out per interface), then the value
        should be equal to the aggregate count across all interfaces.

        An implementation that provides counters per entry per
        interface is not required to also provide an aggregate count,
        e.g., per entry -- the user is expected to be able implement
        the required aggregation if such a count is needed.

matched-octets.description:
Count of the number of octets (bytes) matching the current
        ACL entry.

        An implementation should provide this counter on a
        per-interface per-ACL-entry if possible.

        If an implementation only supports ACL counters per entry
        (i.e., not broken out per interface), then the value
        should be equal to the aggregate count across all interfaces.

        An implementation that provides counters per entry per
        interface is not required to also provide an aggregate count,
        e.g., per entry -- the user is expected to be able implement
        the required aggregation if such a count is needed.

state.description: State information

forwarding-action.description:
Specifies the forwarding action.  One forwarding action
        must be specified for each ACL entry

log-action.description:
Specifies the log action and destination for
        matched packets.  The default is not to log the
        packet.

forwarding-action.description:
Specifies the forwarding action.  One forwarding action
        must be specified for each ACL entry

log-action.description:
Specifies the log action and destination for
        matched packets.  The default is not to log the
        packet.

state.description: State information for ACL actions

actions.description:
Enclosing container for list of ACL actions associated
        with an entry

sequence-id.description:
The sequence id determines the order in which ACL entries
        are applied.  The sequence id must be unique for each entry
        in an ACL set.  Target devices should apply the ACL entry
        rules in the order determined by sequence id, rather than
        the relying only on order in the list.

        belonging to the ACL set (e.g., IPv4, IPv6, etc.)

ingress-acl-sets.description:
Enclosing container the list of ingress ACLs on the
        interface

set-name.description: Reference to set name list key

matched-packets.description:
Count of the number of packets matching the current ACL
        entry.

        An implementation should provide this counter on a
        per-interface per-ACL-entry if possible.

        If an implementation only supports ACL counters per entry
        (i.e., not broken out per interface), then the value
        should be equal to the aggregate count across all interfaces.

        An implementation that provides counters per entry per
        interface is not required to also provide an aggregate count,
        e.g., per entry -- the user is expected to be able implement
        the required aggregation if such a count is needed.

matched-octets.description:
Count of the number of octets (bytes) matching the current
        ACL entry.

        An implementation should provide this counter on a
        per-interface per-ACL-entry if possible.

        If an implementation only supports ACL counters per entry
        (i.e., not broken out per interface), then the value
        should be equal to the aggregate count across all interfaces.

        An implementation that provides counters per entry per
        interface is not required to also provide an aggregate count,
        e.g., per entry -- the user is expected to be able implement
        the required aggregation if such a count is needed.

sequence-id.description:
Reference to an entry in the ACL set applied to an
        interface

state.description: Operational state data for per-interface ACL entries

acl-entries.description: Enclosing container for list of references to ACLs

set-name.description: Reference to the ACL set name applied on egress

type.description: Reference to the ACL set type applied on egress.

set-name.description: Reference to the ACL set name applied on egress

type.description: Reference to the ACL set type applied on egress.

state.description: Operational state data for interface egress ACLs

egress-acl-sets.description:
Enclosing container the list of egress ACLs on the
        interface

id.description:
User-defined identifier for the interface -- a common
        convention could be '<if name>.<subif index>'

User-defined identifier for the interface -- a common
        convention could be '<if name>.<subif index>'

state.description: Operational state for ACL per-interface data

interfaces.description:
Enclosing container for the list of interfaces on which
        ACLs are set

counter-capability.description:
System reported indication of how ACL counters are reported
        by the target

state.description: Global operational state data for ACLs

System reported indication of how ACL counters are reported
        by the target
